channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A California judge rules that Trump's deployment of the guard to LA was illegal
item.description: President Trump took control of the state's National Guard in June and deployed it to Los Angeles to face anti-immigration protestors and assist offic...

item.title: These scientists found Alzheimer's in their genes. Here's what they did next
item.description: Three scientists learned they carry genes that dramatically increase their risk for Alzheimer's disease. Now they're working to keep their brains heal...

item.title: Dozens of scientists find errors in a new Energy Department climate report
item.description: More than 85 scientists say that a recent U.S. Department of Energy report is full of errors and misrepresents climate science.

item.title: Congress returns to Washington. And, Brazil's ex-president starts trial today
item.description: Congress returns to the nation's capital as the deadline to avoid a government shutdown looms. And, Brazil's former president is on trial for attempti...

item.title: Kraft Heinz is splitting up, separating hot dogs from ketchup
item.description: One of the world's largest food brands is splitting apart a decade after a messy megamerger staged by Warren Buffett.

item.title: Firing squad execution of prisoner with dementia blocked by Utah court
item.description: The Utah Supreme Court blocked a death row inmate's upcoming execution, after the inmate's attorneys argued his dementia has significantly worsened.

item.title: Gold price hits record high as investors seek safety
item.description: Experts say uncertainty resulting from US policy is making investors seek safer investments such as gold.

item.title: Maps show how Texas, California redistricting could affect congressional seats
item.description: See maps of how Texas and California's push could play out, based on the 2024 election results.

item.title: Drones blasting rock music help scare wolves away from cattle
item.description: Biologists are using drones to blast AC/DC's "Thunderstruck" and movie clips at the apex predators to shoo them away from cattle.

item.title: North Korea's Kim arrives in Beijing with daughter and possible heir
item.description: The North Korean leader is due to attend a military parade and attend his first multilateral meeting.

item.title: Gérard Depardieu to face trial over rape and sexual assault allegations
item.description: His accuser, Charlotte Arnould, says she is relieved the case is going to court, seven years after she filed a complaint.

item.title: Putin and Kim join China's Xi for powerful show of anti-U.S. force
item.description: China's Xi Jinping has invited Vladimir Putin and North Korea's Kim Jong Un for a display of power, and the rising tide of anti-Western sentiment.

item.title: Final preparations for trial of man accused of attempting to assassinate Trump in Florida
Former CDC directors and acting directors raise concerns in op-ed over RFK Jr.'s decisions
item.description: In a New York Times op-ed, nine former CDC directors and acting directors who served under both Republican and Democratic administrations are voicing ...

item.title: Chloe Malle to become top editor at American Vogue
item.description: The 39-year-old's appointment marks a new era for one of the most influential and glamorous fashion publications.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump's deployment of National Guard to LA
item.description: A federal judge rules the government broke a law limiting domestic use of the military.

item.title: What to know about Guatemalan migrant children and efforts to send them home
item.description: The Trump administration has tried to deport Guatemalan children living in U.S. shelters or foster care.

item.title: Trump says he’s awarding former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom
